Key Arguments: The bill is a step towards totalitarianism and threatens freedom of speech.
The terminology used in the bill is vague and broad, leading to potential misuse.
The bill could formalize and make permanent the informal arrangements between social media companies and government agencies during COVID-19.
The bill exempts government communications from being considered misinformation, indicating bias.
Censorship is more dangerous to democracy than misinformation itself.
Notable Quotes: As I see it this bill is another step towards totalitarianism in our country.
The bill it says will give the government power to regulate 'truth' online by being able to force social media platforms to censor 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' that is 'harmful'.

The fact that this proposed bill explicitly exempts any government communication, from any level of government, being considered misinformation or disinformation, is indicative of the bias and control our government plans to force on the people of Australia.
